title: Tailwind CSS Utilities and Layout
description: Flashcards on utilities, layout, colors, and typography in Tailwind CSS.

cards.q: How to apply margin in Tailwind?
cards.a: Use classes like m-4 for margin on all sides or mt-2 for margin-top.

cards.q: How to apply padding in Tailwind?
cards.a: Use classes like p-4 for padding on all sides or px-2 for horizontal padding.

cards.q: What utility class applies a flexbox container?
cards.a: Use 'flex' class to make an element a flex container.

cards.q: How to justify content using Tailwind?
cards.a: Use classes like justify-center, justify-between, or justify-end.

cards.q: How to align items in flexbox using Tailwind?
cards.a: Use items-start, items-center, or items-end classes.

cards.q: How to set width in Tailwind?
cards.a: Use w- followed by a size like w-1/2 for 50% width or w-full for 100% width.

cards.q: How to set height in Tailwind?
cards.a: Use h- classes such as h-8 or h-screen for full viewport height.

cards.q: How to change background color?
cards.a: Use bg- followed by color name and shade like bg-blue-500.

cards.q: How to set text color?
cards.a: Use text- followed by color and shade like text-red-600.

cards.q: What does the class rounded do?
cards.a: It applies border-radius for rounded corners.

cards.q: How to create a shadow?
cards.a: Use shadow-sm, shadow, or shadow-lg for different shadow sizes.

cards.q: Which class is used for font weight?
cards.a: Use font-bold, font-semibold, font-light, etc.

cards.q: How to change font size?
cards.a: Use text-xs, text-sm, text-lg, text-xl, etc.

cards.q: How to apply uppercase transformation?
cards.a: Use uppercase class to transform text to uppercase.

cards.q: How to add hover effects?
cards.a: Prefix utility classes with hover:, e.g., hover:bg-blue-700.

cards.q: How to control visibility of an element?
cards.a: Use hidden or block classes.

cards.q: How to enable grid layout?
cards.a: Use grid class and specify columns with grid-cols-*

cards.q: How to control gap between grid items?
cards.a: Use gap-*, such as gap-4.

cards.q: How to apply rounded full circle?
cards.a: Use rounded-full for fully rounded circles.

cards.q: How to center text?
cards.a: Use text-center class.
